results.title: Friend or foe
results.creator_credit: John Krish, Gordon L.T. Scott and Children's Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A children’s feature set in Britain during World War II that focuses on the experiences of two London boys sent to board with a farming family during the period of heavy bombing. On one particular day the pilot from a ditched German bomber saves one boy from drowning and the boys must then decide whether or not to tell the English authorities of the German’s whereabouts. Useful for discussion about the sense of war, concepts of right and wrong, the nature of friendship and loyalty, peer group pressure and family relationships. Based on the novel by Michael Morpurgo.

results.title: Idiot box
results.creator_credit: David Caesar, Glenys Rowe and Central Park Films
results.brief_description: Looking for the fast track out of suburban hell, two natural born losers scheme an impossible bank heist. They feel they have strong credentials, as they spend their days watching crime dramas on television and it’s about time they put what they’ve learnt into practive. Kev, angry, unemployed, and an accident waiting to happen gets the guns. Mick, slack, cynical and also unemployed, masterminds the plan. Cast includes Ben Mendelsohn, Jeremy Sims, Robyn Loau and John Polson.

results.title: Lilian's story [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jerzy Domaradzki, Marian MacGowan and CML Film
results.brief_description: Forty years after Lillian Singer had been locked up in a mental institution by her father, she begins a new life. Equipped with a room of her own, an allowance, a strong sense of destiny and the words of Shakespeare, she sets out to live her new life on the streets, buses and taxis of Sydney. This is the extraordinary tale of one woman’s struggle to be free from her past and reclaim the love that was denied her. For Lillian it is never too late to change or discover happiness. Life, for her, is an experience where “everything matters”. Starring Ruth Cracknell and Toni Collette. Adapted from the novel by Kate Grenville. In widescreen format.

results.title: Les Dames du Bois de Boulogne
results.creator_credit: Robert Bresson, Raoul Ploquin and Films Raoul Ploquin
results.brief_description: Made during the last days of the Occupation, the film combines the superficial glamour of Parisian high society with the seething passions and jealousies that cause a spurned femme fatale, Helene (Maria Casares) to seek her ex-lover’s humiliation (Paul Bernard). Helene seeks out two former friends, madame D (Lucienne Bogaert) and her daughter Agnes (Elina Labourdette), a talented dancer who has been forced into prostitution to support herself and her mother. After rescuing them from their desparate situation, Helene ensures that Jean meets Agnes, in the knowledge that he will fall in love and pursue her affections, urged on by Helene’s description of Agnes’s unattainability and chasteness. The inexorable logic of Helene’s scheme seems complete when Jean and Agnes are married, but through the revelation of truth Bresson delivers one of the most moving affirmations of the transcendent and redemptive powers of love. With dialogue written by writer/filmmaker Jean Cocteau, “Les Dames du Bois du Boulogne” was adapted to the screen by Bresson from an anecdote in Denis Diderot’s “Jacques Le Fataliste”. In French with English sub-titles.

results.title: Fox and his friends = Faustrecht der freiheit
results.creator_credit: Rainer Werner Fassbinder, GmbH, City-Film and Tango-Film
results.brief_description: The only one of Fassbinder’s films to explicitly centre on gay male relationships, this film tells the story of a young, working class, unemployed lottery winner who is exploited, with tragic consequences, by his new-found ‘middle class’ friends. This is one of the director’s best socially critical melodramas, focussing on a victim who conspires in his own victimisation, and using the framework of a love story to lay bare the mechanisms of class exploitation. The film’s avoidance of specifically gay issues, and its bleak representation of gay lifestyles, outraged many in the gay community at the time of its release. Now, however, Fassbinder’s presumption that gay men are fundamentally the same as everyone else looks startlingly modern. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: The Neverending story 2: the next chapter
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Dieter Geissler and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Bastian (Jonathan Brandis), the reluctant hero of “The Neverending story” is unhappy away from Fantasia. His dad seems to have forgotten about his deceased mother and is dating someone Bastian doesn’t like, and Bastian didn’t make the swim team because he was afraid of heights and couldn’t jump off the diving board. He is drawn back to Fantasia to the friends he made; the Childlike Empress, Atreyu, Falkor, and Rock Biter. There are also fantastic new creatures to meet like Mudwart, Lavaman, Windbride, Instrument Spinster, Tri-Face, the Wamboes and Nimbly. There is a job to be done in Fanstasia however, as the sorceress Xayide and Smerg the evil dragon have unscrupulous plans for Fantasia. It’s up to Bastian and his friends to once again save Fantasia and prevent a disaster. Also starring Alexandra Johnes, Kenny Morrison, Clarissa Burt and John Wesley Shipp. This video also features a cartoon preview, “Box office bunny”, the first Bugs Bunny theatrical cartoon in 26 years.

results.title: MAC and me
results.creator_credit: Stewart Raffill, R.J. Louis and R J Louis Productions
results.brief_description: Eric, a wheelchair bound boy who has just moved to California begins an unusual friendship with MAC (Mysterious Alien Creature) who has accidentally landed on earth and become separated from his family. Whilst escaping from NASA MAC takes refuge in Eric’s car and accompanies the family to their new home. Eric helps MAC rejoin his family and a strong friendship is formed. Starring Jonathan Ward, Tina Casparay, Lauren Stanley and Jade Calegory.

results.title: Michael
results.creator_credit: Nora Ephron, James Jacks, Sean Daniel and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: When Frank Quinlan (William Hurt) is sent by a tabloid newspaper to investigate the appearance of an angel in a sleepy town in rural Iowa, he and his co-workers Huey Driscoll(Robert Pastorelli) and Dorothy Winters (Andie MacDowell) are surprised to find a chain smoking overweight beerdrinking battle-axe. But as Micheal (John Travolta) explains, he’s not that kind of angel. Soon the three reporters are off on a road trip with the archangel Micheal as they attempt to get him back to Chicago and grab the story of a lifetime. Nora Ephron directs this sweet romance, with Travolta utilising his screen charisma to create an engaging angel.

results.title: Land and Freedom = Tierra y Libertad
results.creator_credit: Ken Loach, Rebecca O'Brien, Road Movies Dritte Produktionen, Messidor Films and Parallax Films
results.brief_description: Land and freedom traces the life of unemployed Liverpool lad David (Ian Hart) who, sick of English pessimism, leaves his home to fight in the Spanish Civil War. The story opens in 1994 as Dave is having a fatal heart attack in his Liverpool council flat. Later, his granddaughter is going through his possessions when she discovers a suitcase filled with clippings and mementos from the Spanish conflict. Included are letters from the front, and strangely, a faded red handkerchief filled with soil. The story jumps back to 1936, when young Dave, a communist, decides he will fight the fascists in Spain. When he joins the Republican workers fighting fascist soldiers in the Barcelona foothills, he finds not only a new purpose in life, but also first love, and eventually political disillusionment. Mainly in English, with sections in Spanish, German, French with sub-titles. Multi-award wining film (Cannes, Euopean Film of the Year) directed by Ken Loach.

results.title: French kiss
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Kasdan, Kathryn F. Galan, Meg Ryan, Eric Fellner, Tim Bevan, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Prufrock Pictures and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: Kevin Kline and Meg Ryan star in this romantic comedy about two people stuck in Paris, France. The most romantic city in the world. A place where anything can happen. And it does!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lawrence Kasdan, Kathryn F. Galan, Meg Ryan, Eric Fellner, Tim Bevan, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Prufrock Pictures and Working Title Films
